alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 1:40PM PST until December 21 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED DURING THE NEXT WEEK... .The first of several rounds of precipitation will continue to cross Trinity County through this afternoon into this evening, before tapering off tonight. Snow levels may start off near 2500 to 3000 feet in parts of northeast Trinity County, but are above 3000 feet along the Highway 299 corridor, and will tend to rise tonight. Most Trinity County passes will just have wet road conditions, with travel impacts mainly limited to higher portions of highway 3 north of Weaverville. The next round of precipitation will arrive by late Wednesday afternoon and evening. Snow levels on Wednesday will generally be near or above 4000 feet. However, colder air will spread across the region Friday, with snow levels around 2500 to 3000 feet. Even lower snow levels along with additional precipitation is expected for the weekend across much of Northwest California. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 4000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with higher amounts in the Trinity Alps. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 3000 feet, expect periods of wet snow with additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Northern Trinity County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 1 PM Wednesday to 10 AM PST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult over some mountain passes along Highways 3. Plan on slippery and potentially snow- covered roads, and carry chains. On Wednesday and Wednesday Night, travel over Scott Mountain Summit could be very difficult to impossible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
